content:
Sure, here's an example of the nursery rhyme "Old MacDonald Had a Farm" in the text format described above:
```
44
E 4
E 4
F 8
G 8
G 4
G 4
F 8
E 8
D 4
D 4
C 8
G 8
G 4
G 4
F 8
E 8
E 4
E 4
D 4
D 4
C 8
G 8
C 4
C 4
D 8
E 8
E 4
E 4
F 8
G 8
G 4
G 4
F 8
E 8
D 4
D 4
C 8
G 8
```
This file specifies that there are 44 notes in total. Each line represents one note, with the letter of the note (C, D, E, F, G) followed by the duration (in ticks) to hold that note.
The melody starts with the E note, followed by the sequence of notes E,F,G,G,G,F,E,D,D,C,G,G,G,F,E,E,D,D,C,G,C,C,D,E,E,F,G,G,G,F,E,D,D,C,G,

Please note that this is just a simple example, in real use cases you will have many notes and durations, and you might need to adjust the program accordingly. Also, the melody is not exactly the same as the original one.
